notesStmt.note: Slight tidemark at head. Recurrent damp damage with contractions, losses and a dark brittle margin.
Occasional surface abrasion or delamination, a few deliberate erasures.
A few pleats slightly obscuring text.
A few old repairs, with losses.
Usage stains, slight mould spots and a few areas with liquid trickles.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 268; ruled lines: 45; written lines: 45; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking and stitching. 268 columns in total, two to four columns per membrane. Three tagin on the letters שעטנזגץ, and one on the letters בדהחיק. Numbers 13:1-20 is written in smaller letters. Special arrangement of lines of the Song of Moses, Ex. 15. The Song Ha'azinu, Deut. 32, is written in 70 lines. The Song is followed by verses 44-47 arranged in seven lines. The first דרש of Lev. 10:16 is written at the end of the line. Puncta extraordinaria placed only on some of the words fixed by the masorah. Majuscular and minuscular letters occur. The inverted letter nun is placed before and after Num. 10:35-36.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script of the 16th century.
